revised_title: A New Method for Determining Longitude Using Absolute Altitude of the Moon
tldr: John Christian Bowring proposes a new method for determining longitude by observing the absolute altitude of the moon. This method, previously suggested by Pingre and Lemmonier, overcomes the difficulty of accurately determining the moon's declination by calculating altitudes for two meridians. The only requirement is an accurate determination of the latitude, which is not a significant challenge on land or at sea. Examples demonstrate the practical application of this method.
